Html: How do i send any mouse events? Like LButtonDwn LButtonUp Mouse Move. Give an example or function name to do things like that. Thanks.

// Make sure you added the input simulator project
// to your solution, referenced it in the current project
// and used it like this:
using WindowsInput;

// ..then do the other stuff required for a working application...

// ... and during some initialization part create a new
// instance of the input simulator...
TheInputSimulator = new InputSimulator();

// ...and from then on you can send button events
// just like this...
TheInputSimulator.Mouse.LeftButtonDown();

Hi there,

There's been code sitting in the repo that hasn't been released which simulates mouse events. Just download the latest version, compile and include in your application. There are some tests which should show you how to use the API.

Cheers,
Mike

On Tue, Jul 3, 2012 at 6:58 PM, ZoltanE <notifications@codeplex.com> wrote:

From: ZoltanE

// Make sure you added the input simulator project
// to your solution, referenced it in the current project
// and used it like this:
using WindowsInput;

// ..then do the other stuff required for a working application...

// ... and during some initialization part create a new
// instance of the input simulator...
TheInputSimulator = new InputSimulator();

// ...and from then on you can send button events
// just like this...
TheInputSimulator.Mouse.LeftButtonDown();
